required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Refinement of Suicide Risk Management Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Refinement of Suicide Risk Management Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: Participants will be randomly assigned to 1 of the 4 interventions using a sequential stratified randomization procedure. We will use sex (M, F) and history of suicide attempts (never, 1, and multiple) as our randomization strata. Participants will be assessed before and after the intervention to study the potential effects of each approach on suicide-related clinical outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in suicide relevant thoughts and behaviors after the intervention (Self Injurious Thoughts and Behaviors questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During an average of 2-weeks pre-intervention, 2-weeks post-intervention, 1 month follow-up after intervention
primary_outcome.description: Items from the Self Injurious Thoughts and Behaviors questionnaire (Fox et al., 2020) will be used to assess suicide relevant thoughts and behaviors

arm_group.description: In the structured interview approach, clinicians ask a series of predetermined questions and/or assess a specified set of risk and protective factors, typically using a checklist-based approach. The safety plan is a written, prioritized list of coping strategies and resources for reducing suicide risk.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Structured interview and Crisis Response Plan
arm_group.description: In the structured interview approach, clinicians ask a series of predetermined questions and/or assess a specified set of risk and protective factors, typically using a checklist-based approach. Crisis response planning intervention teaches a range of coping strategies and provides support that can reduce suicide attempts and ideation.

In the narrative assessment approach, clinicians ask patients to "tell the story" of their suicidal crisis. The safety plan is a written, prioritized list of coping strategies and resources for reducing suicide risk.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Narrative assessment and Crisis Response Plan
arm_group.description: In the narrative assessment approach, clinicians ask patients to "tell the story" of their suicidal crisis. Crisis response planning intervention teaches a range of coping strategies and provides support that can reduce suicide attempts and ideation.

intervention.description: The safety plan is a written, prioritized list of coping strategies and resources for reducing suicide risk.
Crisis response planning intervention teaches a range of coping strategies and provides support that can reduce suicide attempts and ideation.
intervention.arm_group_label: Narrative assessment and Crisis Response Plan
Structured interview and Crisis Response Plan

intervention.description: In the structured interview approach, clinicians ask a series of predetermined questions and/or assess a specified set of risk and protective factors, typically using a checklist-based approach.
intervention.arm_group_label: Structured interview and Crisis Response Plan

intervention.description: In the narrative assessment approach, clinicians ask patients to "tell the story" of their suicidal crisis.
intervention.arm_group_label: Narrative assessment and Crisis Response Plan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Individuals scoring 5 or higher on the Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation to screen for suicidal ideation and a history of suicide attempts
Exclusion Criteria:
-
